The Marvelous Mechanical Mansion of Fritz von Weerg
DM [BN] BOT 01-08-2022 13:49
Blinsky has been talking around town about Fritz von Weerg, and how he's just heard of the Marvelous Mansion, and it's still intact, just 30 minutes outside Krezk! Curiosity? A desire to help? For whatever reason, you've decided to scout this out for Blinsky, who says "Oh, I couldn't! The roads are too dangerous for toymaker Blinsky! But I want to hear all about about it! Every last detail! And Blinsky pays extra for schematics!" (edited)
DM [BN] BOT 01-08-2022 13:51
The journey to Krezk is uneventful, the roads peacefully quiet, if cold and damp for a change. The guards at Krezk are abrupt, and not friendly to outsiders, but quickly enough give directions to the Haunted Mansion, just over that low ridge over there.
DM [BN] BOT 01-08-2022 13:52
Tucked far beyond a crumbling stone fence and shrouded in towering pine trees stands a cobblestone mansion that towers over the clearing in the trees. While the skeleton of the stone structure itself stands firm, wooden braces and support beams have been eaten away by rot and grasping vines. The building has no discernible windows, but there is a single prominent door at the end of the dirt path.
Fritz (they/them) BOT 01-08-2022 13:56
Fritz looks on, mind still full of all Blindly had said about this other Fritz, it was a little confusing. Fritz had given to understand that they were given this name because of their glitching, and had no idea it was a real name of a real person. And for it to be related to machines and mechanisms... Fritz had yet to ponder the philosophy of coincidence and fate but what was certain was that something felt off, something didn't sit well.
Umbrae BOT 01-08-2022 14:12
Umbrae travels to Krezk by air, naturally preferring her boom of flying over other forms of transport. Her mismatched eyes scan the area as they go, and linger on the mansion when they approach. She guides her broom toward it, wanting to circle the structure and get a better look at the details. The lack of windows is disturbing, but all the more reason to investigate carefully.

DM [BN] BOT 02-08-2022 13:38
Octavia tells Talon to open the door. Talon moves forward, while everyone else stays a safe distance back. Peering through the doorway, partially lit by the light of day, or as far ask you can see for those of you with darkvision, you see: A sprawling, chillingly quiet, and destitute ballroom populated entirely by furniture draped with dust-coated sheets. A grand balcony extends across the entirety of the second floor encircling the room overhead. Out of the corner of your eye, you could swear that you see one the sheets move. Ever so slightly... The mansion, as Belnir can tell you from his very accurate surveying, is much smaller on the outside than the inside. The exterior dimensions he measured were no more than 50 feet deep by 100 feet wide. But the interior, it easily stretches beyond what you can in terms of depth. And you're not sure of interior width, given the angle you're looking at it from.

FURNACE ROOM / WORKSHOP The remaining drone continues it's work, shoveling things into and out of the fire. Three of the four cages are empty. These are the remains of Marek Fidatov, a long lost relative of an old Krezkian family, as determined by a signet ring on it's finger. The family would likely gladly pay for the recovery of the long lost remains. Fritz is able to recover the remains of Fritz Von Weerg. FRITZ VON WEERG'S SECRET BUNKER The room at the base of the slide, where you first encountered Fritz. There are banners on the wall. The banners on the wall are house banners. The red showcases the never before seen rifles of the Von Weerg house and the purple is adorned with the gilded lions Dilisnya house. There is a skeleton under the workbench. It is small, gnome sized. With some deduction, you can determine it's the original body of Fritz Von Weerg. There are some schematics on the workbench. Fritz made a mechanical heart, for his mechanical man, to contain his mortal soul. A phylactery of sorts. You can tell heart in the mechanical body is intact - Fritz Von Weerg's soul is likely still trapped in it, in some twisted version of immortality. The barrels in the workshop contain assorted valuable components - gem dust, platinum ingots, and so forth. Fritz von Werg himself has a few magic items on him, including slippers, glasses and his blunderbuss. ROTATING ROOM Off of the furnace/forge room, between it and the elevator, is a room thick with steam. It seems to be a large, room size manifold for directing steam throughout the mansion. There's control levers in the wall, that when pulled, rotate the entire room, redirecting which steam pipes are connect and active. But it's in massive disrepair, so steam is venting everywhere. With some tumbling (or maybe just flying), and trial and error, you're able to get it lined up so a small tunnel connects to the elevator. The elevator is there.
